trans-unit.source: Step 5: Deploy the Machine Learning web service | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Step 5: Deploy the Machine Learning web service | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Step 5 of the Develop a predictive solution walkthrough: Deploy a predictive experiment in Machine Learning Studio as a web service.
trans-unit.target: Step 5 of the Develop a predictive solution walkthrough: Deploy a predictive experiment in Machine Learning Studio as a web service.

trans-unit.source: Walkthrough Step 5: Deploy the Azure Machine Learning web service
trans-unit.target: Walkthrough Step 5: Deploy the Azure Machine Learning web service

trans-unit.source: This is the fifth step of the walkthrough, [Develop a predictive analytics solution in Azure Machine Learning](machine-learning-walkthrough-develop-predictive-solution.md)
trans-unit.target: This is the fifth step of the walkthrough, [Develop a predictive analytics solution in Azure Machine Learning](machine-learning-walkthrough-develop-predictive-solution.md)

trans-unit.source: [Create a Machine Learning workspace](machine-learning-walkthrough-1-create-ml-workspace.md)
trans-unit.target: [Create a Machine Learning workspace](machine-learning-walkthrough-1-create-ml-workspace.md)

trans-unit.source: [Upload existing data](machine-learning-walkthrough-2-upload-data.md)
trans-unit.target: [Upload existing data](machine-learning-walkthrough-2-upload-data.md)

trans-unit.source: [Create a new experiment](machine-learning-walkthrough-3-create-new-experiment.md)
trans-unit.target: [Create a new experiment](machine-learning-walkthrough-3-create-new-experiment.md)

trans-unit.source: [Train and evaluate the models](machine-learning-walkthrough-4-train-and-evaluate-models.md)
trans-unit.target: [Train and evaluate the models](machine-learning-walkthrough-4-train-and-evaluate-models.md)

trans-unit.source: **Deploy the web service**
trans-unit.target: **Deploy the web service**

trans-unit.source: [Access the web service](machine-learning-walkthrough-6-access-web-service.md)
trans-unit.target: [Access the web service](machine-learning-walkthrough-6-access-web-service.md)

trans-unit.source: To give others a chance to use the predictive model we've developed in this walkthrough, we'll deploy it as a web service on Azure.
trans-unit.target: To give others a chance to use the predictive model we've developed in this walkthrough, we'll deploy it as a web service on Azure.

trans-unit.source: Up to this point we've been experimenting with training our model.
trans-unit.target: Up to this point we've been experimenting with training our model.

trans-unit.source: But the deployed service is no longer going to do training - it will be generating predictions by scoring the user's input based on our model.
trans-unit.target: But the deployed service is no longer going to do training - it will be generating predictions by scoring the user's input based on our model.

trans-unit.source: So we're going to do some preparation to convert this experiment from a ***training*** experiment to a ***predictive*** experiment.
trans-unit.target: So we're going to do some preparation to convert this experiment from a ***training*** experiment to a ***predictive*** experiment.

trans-unit.source: So this is a two-step process:
trans-unit.target: So this is a two-step process:

trans-unit.source: Convert the *training experiment* we've created into a *predictive experiment*
trans-unit.target: Convert the *training experiment* we've created into a *predictive experiment*

trans-unit.source: Deploy the predictive experiment as a web service
trans-unit.target: Deploy the predictive experiment as a web service

trans-unit.source: But first, we need to trim this experiment down a little.
trans-unit.target: But first, we need to trim this experiment down a little.

trans-unit.source: We currently have two different models in the experiment, but we only want one model when we deploy this as a web service.
trans-unit.target: We currently have two different models in the experiment, but we only want one model when we deploy this as a web service.

trans-unit.source: Let's say we've decided that the boosted tree model was the better model to use.
trans-unit.target: Let's say we've decided that the boosted tree model was the better model to use.

trans-unit.source: So the first thing to do is remove the [Two-Class Support Vector Machine][two-class-support-vector-machine] module and the modules that were used for training it.
trans-unit.target: So the first thing to do is remove the [Two-Class Support Vector Machine][two-class-support-vector-machine] module and the modules that were used for training it.

trans-unit.source: You may want to make a copy of the experiment first by clicking **Save As** at the bottom of the experiment canvas.
trans-unit.target: You may want to make a copy of the experiment first by clicking **Save As** at the bottom of the experiment canvas.

trans-unit.source: We need to delete the following modules:
trans-unit.target: We need to delete the following modules:

trans-unit.source: [Two-Class Support Vector Machine][two-class-support-vector-machine]
trans-unit.target: [Two-Class Support Vector Machine][two-class-support-vector-machine]

trans-unit.source: [Train Model][train-model] and [Score Model][score-model] modules that were connected to it
trans-unit.target: [Train Model][train-model] and [Score Model][score-model] modules that were connected to it

trans-unit.source: [Normalize Data][normalize-data] (both of them)
trans-unit.target: [Normalize Data][normalize-data] (both of them)

trans-unit.source: [Evaluate Model][evaluate-model]
trans-unit.target: [Evaluate Model][evaluate-model]

trans-unit.source: Just select the module and press the Delete key, or right-click the module and select **Delete**.
trans-unit.target: Just select the module and press the Delete key, or right-click the module and select **Delete**.

trans-unit.source: Now we're ready to deploy this model using the [Two-Class Boosted Decision Tree][two-class-boosted-decision-tree].
trans-unit.target: Now we're ready to deploy this model using the [Two-Class Boosted Decision Tree][two-class-boosted-decision-tree].

trans-unit.source: Convert the training experiment to a predictive experiment
trans-unit.target: Convert the training experiment to a predictive experiment

trans-unit.source: Converting to a predictive experiment involves three steps:
trans-unit.target: Converting to a predictive experiment involves three steps:

trans-unit.source: Save the model we've trained and then replace our training modules
trans-unit.target: Save the model we've trained and then replace our training modules

trans-unit.source: Trim the experiment to remove modules that were only needed for training
trans-unit.target: Trim the experiment to remove modules that were only needed for training

trans-unit.source: Define where the web service will accept input and where it will generate output
trans-unit.target: Define where the web service will accept input and where it will generate output

trans-unit.source: Fortunately, all three steps can be accomplished by just clicking **Deploy Web Service** at the bottom of the experiment canvas (select the **Predictive Web Service** option).
trans-unit.target: Fortunately, all three steps can be accomplished by just clicking **Deploy Web Service** at the bottom of the experiment canvas (select the **Predictive Web Service** option).

trans-unit.source: When you click **Deploy Web Service**, several things happen:
trans-unit.target: When you click **Deploy Web Service**, several things happen:

trans-unit.source: The model we trained is saved as a single **Trained Model** module into the module palette to the left of the experiment canvas (you can find it under **Trained Models**).
trans-unit.target: The model we trained is saved as a single **Trained Model** module into the module palette to the left of the experiment canvas (you can find it under **Trained Models**).

trans-unit.source: Modules that were used for training are removed.
trans-unit.target: Modules that were used for training are removed.

trans-unit.source: Specifically:
trans-unit.target: Specifically:

trans-unit.source: [Two-Class Boosted Decision Tree][two-class-boosted-decision-tree]
trans-unit.target: [Two-Class Boosted Decision Tree][two-class-boosted-decision-tree]

trans-unit.source: [Train Model][train-model]
trans-unit.target: [Train Model][train-model]

trans-unit.source: [Split Data][split]
trans-unit.target: [Split Data][split]

trans-unit.source: the second [Execute R Script][execute-r-script] module that was used for test data
trans-unit.target: the second [Execute R Script][execute-r-script] module that was used for test data

trans-unit.source: The saved trained model is added back into the experiment.
trans-unit.target: The saved trained model is added back into the experiment.

trans-unit.source: **Web service input** and **Web service output** modules are added.
trans-unit.target: **Web service input** and **Web service output** modules are added.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The experiment has been saved in two parts under tabs that have been added at the top of the experiment canvas: the original training experiment is under the tab **Training experiment**, and the newly-created predictive experiment is under **Predictive experiment**.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The experiment has been saved in two parts under tabs that have been added at the top of the experiment canvas: the original training experiment is under the tab **Training experiment**, and the newly-created predictive experiment is under **Predictive experiment**.

trans-unit.source: We need to take one additional step with this particular experiment.
trans-unit.target: We need to take one additional step with this particular experiment.

trans-unit.source: We added two [Execute R Script][execute-r-script] modules to provide a weighting function to the data for training and testing.
trans-unit.target: We added two [Execute R Script][execute-r-script] modules to provide a weighting function to the data for training and testing.

trans-unit.source: We don't need to do that in the final model.
trans-unit.target: We don't need to do that in the final model.

trans-unit.source: Machine Learning Studio removed one [Execute R Script][execute-r-script] module when it removed the [Split][split] module, so now we can now remove the other and connect [Metadata Editor][metadata-editor] directly to [Score Model][score-model].
trans-unit.target: Machine Learning Studio removed one [Execute R Script][execute-r-script] module when it removed the [Split][split] module, so now we can now remove the other and connect [Metadata Editor][metadata-editor] directly to [Score Model][score-model].

trans-unit.source: Our experiment should now look like this:
trans-unit.target: Our experiment should now look like this:

trans-unit.source: ![Scoring the trained model][4]
trans-unit.target: ![Scoring the trained model][4]

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] You may be wondering why we left the UCI German Credit Card Data dataset in the predictive experiment.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] You may be wondering why we left the UCI German Credit Card Data dataset in the predictive experiment.

trans-unit.source: The service is going to use the user's data, not the original dataset, so why leave the original dataset in the model?
trans-unit.target: The service is going to use the user's data, not the original dataset, so why leave the original dataset in the model?

trans-unit.source: It's true that the service doesn't need the original credit card data.
trans-unit.target: It's true that the service doesn't need the original credit card data.

trans-unit.source: But it does need the schema for that data, which includes information such as how many columns there are and which columns are numeric.
trans-unit.target: But it does need the schema for that data, which includes information such as how many columns there are and which columns are numeric.

trans-unit.source: This schema information is necessary in order to interpret the user's data.
trans-unit.target: This schema information is necessary in order to interpret the user's data.

trans-unit.source: We leave these components connected so that the scoring module will have the dataset schema when the service is running.
trans-unit.target: We leave these components connected so that the scoring module will have the dataset schema when the service is running.

trans-unit.source: The data isn't used, just the schema.
trans-unit.target: The data isn't used, just the schema.

trans-unit.source: Run the experiment one last time (click **Run**).
trans-unit.target: Run the experiment one last time (click **Run**).

trans-unit.source: If you want to verify that the model is still working, click the output of the [Score Model][score-model] module and select **View Results**.
trans-unit.target: If you want to verify that the model is still working, click the output of the [Score Model][score-model] module and select **View Results**.

trans-unit.source: You'll see that the original data is displayed, along with the credit risk value ("Scored Labels") and the scoring probability value ("Scored Probabilities").
trans-unit.target: You'll see that the original data is displayed, along with the credit risk value ("Scored Labels") and the scoring probability value ("Scored Probabilities").

trans-unit.source: Deploy the web service
trans-unit.target: Deploy the web service

trans-unit.source: To deploy a web service derived from our experiment, click **Deploy Web Service** below the canvas.
trans-unit.target: To deploy a web service derived from our experiment, click **Deploy Web Service** below the canvas.

trans-unit.source: Machine Learning Studio deploys the experiment as a web service and takes you to the dashboard for that web service.
trans-unit.target: Machine Learning Studio deploys the experiment as a web service and takes you to the dashboard for that web service.

trans-unit.source: From here you can return to the experiment (**View snapshot** or **View latest**) and run a simple test of the web service (**Test** button - see **Test the web service** below).
trans-unit.target: From here you can return to the experiment (**View snapshot** or **View latest**) and run a simple test of the web service (**Test** button - see **Test the web service** below).

trans-unit.source: There is also information here for creating applications that can access the web service (more on that in the next step of this walkthrough).
trans-unit.target: There is also information here for creating applications that can access the web service (more on that in the next step of this walkthrough).

trans-unit.source: ![Web service dashboard][6]
trans-unit.target: ![Web service dashboard][6]

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.TIP] You can update the web service after you've deployed it.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.TIP] You can update the web service after you've deployed it.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you want to change your model, just edit the training experiment, tweak the model parameters, and click **Deploy Web Service**.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you want to change your model, just edit the training experiment, tweak the model parameters, and click **Deploy Web Service**.

trans-unit.source: When you deploy the experiment again, it will replace the web service, now using your updated model.
trans-unit.target: When you deploy the experiment again, it will replace the web service, now using your updated model.

trans-unit.source: You can configure the service by clicking the **CONFIGURATION** tab.
trans-unit.target: You can configure the service by clicking the **CONFIGURATION** tab.

trans-unit.source: Here you can modify the service name (it's given the experiment name by default) and give it a description.
trans-unit.target: Here you can modify the service name (it's given the experiment name by default) and give it a description.

trans-unit.source: You can also give more friendly labels for the input and output columns.
trans-unit.target: You can also give more friendly labels for the input and output columns.

trans-unit.source: ![Configure the web service][5]
trans-unit.target: ![Configure the web service][5]

trans-unit.source: Test the web service
trans-unit.target: Test the web service

trans-unit.source: On the **DASHBOARD** page, click the **Test** button under **Default Endpoint**.
trans-unit.target: On the **DASHBOARD** page, click the **Test** button under **Default Endpoint**.

trans-unit.source: A dialog will pop up and ask you for the input data for the service.
trans-unit.target: A dialog will pop up and ask you for the input data for the service.

trans-unit.source: These are the same columns that appeared in the original German credit risk dataset.
trans-unit.target: These are the same columns that appeared in the original German credit risk dataset.

trans-unit.source: Enter a set of data and then click **OK**.
trans-unit.target: Enter a set of data and then click **OK**.

trans-unit.source: In the web service, the data enters through the **Web service input** module, through the [Metadata Editor][metadata-editor] module, and to the [Score Model][score-model] module where it's scored.
trans-unit.target: In the web service, the data enters through the **Web service input** module, through the [Metadata Editor][metadata-editor] module, and to the [Score Model][score-model] module where it's scored.

trans-unit.source: The results are then output from the web service through the **Web service output**.
trans-unit.target: The results are then output from the web service through the **Web service output**.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.TIP] The way we have the predictive experiment configured, the entire results from the [Score Model][score-model] module are returned.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.TIP] The way we have the predictive experiment configured, the entire results from the [Score Model][score-model] module are returned.

trans-unit.source: This includes all the input data plus the credit risk value and the scoring probability.
trans-unit.target: This includes all the input data plus the credit risk value and the scoring probability.

trans-unit.source: If you wanted to return something different - for example, only the credit risk value - then you could insert a [Project Columns][project-columns] module between [Score Model][score-model] and the **Web service output** to eliminate columns you don't want the web service to return.
trans-unit.target: If you wanted to return something different - for example, only the credit risk value - then you could insert a [Project Columns][project-columns] module between [Score Model][score-model] and the **Web service output** to eliminate columns you don't want the web service to return.

trans-unit.source: Manage the web service
trans-unit.target: Manage the web service

trans-unit.source: Once you've deployed your web service, you can manage it from the [Azure classic portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com).
trans-unit.target: Once you've deployed your web service, you can manage it from the [Azure classic portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com).

trans-unit.source: Sign-in to the [Azure classic portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com).
trans-unit.target: Sign-in to the [Azure classic portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com).

trans-unit.source: In the Microsoft Azure services panel, click **MACHINE LEARNING**.
trans-unit.target: In the Microsoft Azure services panel, click **MACHINE LEARNING**.

trans-unit.source: Click your workspace.
trans-unit.target: Click your workspace.

trans-unit.source: Click the **WEB SERVICES** tab.
trans-unit.target: Click the **WEB SERVICES** tab.

trans-unit.source: Click the web service we just created.
trans-unit.target: Click the web service we just created.

trans-unit.source: Click the "default" endpoint.
trans-unit.target: Click the "default" endpoint.

trans-unit.source: From here you can do things like monitor how the web service is doing and make performance tweaks by changing how many concurrent calls the service can handle.
trans-unit.target: From here you can do things like monitor how the web service is doing and make performance tweaks by changing how many concurrent calls the service can handle.

trans-unit.source: You can even publish your web service in the Azure Marketplace.
trans-unit.target: You can even publish your web service in the Azure Marketplace.

trans-unit.source: For more details, see:
trans-unit.target: For more details, see:

trans-unit.source: [Creating Endpoints](machine-learning-create-endpoint.md)
trans-unit.target: [Creating Endpoints](machine-learning-create-endpoint.md)

trans-unit.source: [Scaling web service](machine-learning-scaling-webservice.md)
trans-unit.target: [Scaling web service](machine-learning-scaling-webservice.md)

trans-unit.source: [Publish Azure Machine Learning Web Service to the Azure Marketplace](machine-learning-publish-web-service-to-azure-marketplace.md)
trans-unit.target: [Publish Azure Machine Learning Web Service to the Azure Marketplace](machine-learning-publish-web-service-to-azure-marketplace.md)

trans-unit.source: **Next: [Access the web service](machine-learning-walkthrough-6-access-web-service.md)**
trans-unit.target: **Next: [Access the web service](machine-learning-walkthrough-6-access-web-service.md)**
